means: transformation-induced plasticity 高强度及高延性

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"旅行"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: journey, tour, travel, trip, voyage, excursion, expedition, cruise
means: journey ： 最普通用词，侧重指时间较长、距离较远的单程陆上旅行，也指水上或空中的旅行。
tour ： 指最后反回出发地，旅途中有停留游览点，距离可长可短，目的各异的周游或巡行。
travel ： 泛指旅行的行为而不指某次具体的旅行，多指到远方作长期旅行，不强调直接目的地，单、复数均可用。
trip ： 普通用词，口语多用，常指为公务或游玩作的较短暂的旅行。
voyage ： 指在水上旅行，尤指海上旅行，也可指空中旅行。
excursion ： 较正式用词，常指不超过一天的短时期娱乐性游玩，也可指乘火车或轮船往返特定景点的远足旅游。
expedition ： 指有特定目的远征或探险。
cruise ： 主要指乘船的游览并在多处停靠。

word_mean: 在斜井或斜巷内用钢丝绳牵引的由两个以上矿车组成的车组。

sentence.Network_en: She rejected his advances during the trip to Cannes.
sentence.Network_cn: 在去往戛纳的途中，她拒绝了他的挑逗。

sentence.Network_en: Prior to his Japan trip, he went to New York.
sentence.Network_cn: 在去日本之前，他去了纽约。

sentence.Network_en: They are planning on a trip to Guyana next month.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们计划下个月去圭亚那旅行。

lj.lj_ly: tripped up on the last question.
lj.lj_ls: 在最后一个问题上犯了错误

means.word_mean: 旅行;航行
绊倒;跌倒
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French triper, from Middle Dutch trippen 'to skip, hop'

entry.def: A trip is a journey that you make to a particular place.

example.ex: On the Thursday we went out on a day trip...
example.tran: 星期四我们出去玩了一天。

example.ex: Mark was sent to the Far East on a business trip.

entry.def: If you trip when you are walking, you knock your foot against something and fall or nearly fall.

example.ex: She tripped and fell last night and broke her hip...
example.tran: 她昨晚绊倒了，摔坏了髋骨。

example.ex: He tried to follow Jack's footsteps in the snow and tripped on a rock...
example.tran: 他想要跟着杰克在雪中留下的脚印走，却让一块石头绊倒了。

entry.tran: 使绊;将…绊倒; 使跌倒
entry.def: If you trip someone who is walking or running, you put your foot or something else in front of them, so that they knock their own foot against it and fall or nearly fall.

example.ex: One guy stuck his foot out and tried to trip me.
example.tran: 一个家伙把脚伸出来想要绊倒我。

entry.tran: (对权力等的)迷恋;(内疚、怀旧感等的)困扰
entry.def: If you say that someone is, for example, on a power trip, a guilt trip, or a nostalgia trip, you mean that their behaviour is motivated by power, guilt, or nostalgia.

example.ex: There's such pressure to be happy in Hawaii, if you're unhappy you're on a guilt trip...
example.tran: 就好像去夏威夷就一定要开心似的，如果你不开心，你会一个劲儿地感到愧疚。

example.ex: The biggest star perk, and the biggest power trip, must be the private plane.
example.tran: 顶级的明星待遇和无上的权力体验肯定要数私人飞机了。

entry.def: A trip is an experience that someone has when their mind is affected by a drug such as LSD.

example.ex: An anxious or depressed person can experience a really bad trip.
example.tran: 焦虑或抑郁的人吸毒后可能会有非常糟糕的幻觉。

entry.def: If someone is tripping, they are having an experience in which their mind is affected by a drug such as LSD.

example.ex: One night I was tripping on acid.
example.tran: 有一天晚上我服用了迷幻药后正在幻游。

entry.def: If someone trips somewhere, they walk there with light, quick steps.

example.ex: A girl in a red smock tripped down the hill...
example.tran: 一个身穿红色罩衫的女孩迈着轻快的步子下山。

example.ex: They tripped along with scarcely a care in the world.
example.tran: 他们轻快地走着，几乎没有世间的烦恼。

means.word_mean: 1. a journey for some purpose (usually including the return);

sentences.sentence: "he took a trip to the shopping center"

means.word_mean: 2. a hallucinatory experience induced by drugs;
3. an accidental misstep threatening (or causing) a fall;

sentences.sentence: "he blamed his slip on the ice"
"the jolt caused many slips and a few spills"

means.word_mean: 4. an exciting or stimulting experience
5. a catch mechanism that acts as a switch;

sentences.sentence: "the pressure activates the tripper and releases the water"

means.word_mean: 6. a light or nimble tread;

sentences.sentence: "he heard the trip of women's feet overhead"

means.word_mean: 7. an unintentional but embarrassing blunder;

sentences.sentence: "he recited the whole poem without a single trip"
"he arranged his robes to avoid a trip-up later"

means.word_mean: 1. miss a step and fall or nearly fall;
2. cause to stumble;

sentences.sentence: "The questions on the test tripped him up"

means.word_mean: 3. make a trip for pleasure
4. put in motion or move to act;
5. get high, stoned, or drugged;

abbreviation.mean_cn: 三倍数，三个一组，三倍的，三倍与，增至三倍

Sentence.sentence: Yesterday I made reservations for my trip to Miami next month.
Do you think you could pop through and bring me up to date on the arrangements for the Italian trip
Inform him of the arrangements for his trip in Italy.
The question is often asked whether every butterfly makes the round trip journey every year.
Well, we're offering an all-inclusive two-week trip to Mexico for only 300 dollars.
Em, did she ever explain why she didn't show up for the Denver trip

means.word_mean: 旅行, 旅游, 有目的的外出

sentences.en: I'll make a bus trip to the town next week.
sentences.cn: 下星期我将乘公共汽车进城。

sentences.en: He often makes a round trip to the hospital alone.
sentences.cn: 他经常一个人往返医院。

means.word_mean: 轻快地行走[奔跑, 跳舞]

sentences.en: The child tripped lightly like a bird.
sentences.cn: 那个孩子像鸟儿一样轻快地奔跑着。

sentences.en: She is tripping along with her little steps.
sentences.cn: 她踏着小步在轻盈地跳着舞。

means.word_mean: 绊；绊倒(与 on， over 连用)

sentences.en: The old man tripped over a stone.

means.word_mean: 犯错误；失误(与 on， over 连用)

sentences.en: The student tripped on that difficult question.

means.word_mean: 说话结结巴巴，支支吾吾

sentences.en: He trips when he gets drunk.

means.word_mean: 旅行
(勾脚)绊倒；把…绊倒(与 up 连用)

sentences.en: The child tripped him up by the heels.
sentences.cn: 小孩用脚后跟将他绊倒。

sentences.en: He stuck his foot out and tripped me.

means.word_mean: (使)犯错误

sentences.en: He tripped when trying to spell this word.
sentences.cn: 他在拼写这个词时拼错了。

sentences.en: The clever lawyer tripped the witness.
sentences.cn: 那个聪明的律师使证人说错了话。

means.word_mean: 使失败；使受挫折；使停顿(与 up 连用)

sentences.en: The boxer tripped his opponent up.

means.word_mean: 抓住(某人的)谎言、过错等；揭露；暴露(与 up 连用)

sentences.en: His wrong doing will inevitably trips itself up.
sentences.cn: 他干的坏事必然会暴露。

jushi.english: I made a special trip to see him.
The trip to California is farther than I thought.
jushi.chinese: 到加州的路程比我想象的还远。

jushi.english: My throat was dry after the long trip.
jushi.chinese: 经过长途跋涉,我的喉咙发干。
